intro: Acer amplum var. jianshuiense, commonly known as the Jianshui maple, is a variant of the common maple native to China. It is characterized by its distinctive palmate leaves that turn vibrant red in the fall. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions with well-drained soil and moderate climates. Its bark is smooth and grayish-brown, becoming fissured with age. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens and parks.
distribution_native_art_desc: Acer amplum var. jianshuiense is primarily native to the Yunnan Province in China. This variety of maple is found in the mountainous regions of southern Yunnan, particularly in the Jianshui County area. It grows in subtropical and temperate climates at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 2,500 meters. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas with moderate humidity. It is a rare and endemic species, contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
distribution_introduced_art_desc: Acer amplum var. jianshuiense was mainly introduced to the southern regions of China, particularly in the Yunnan and Guizhou provinces. This introduction is primarily due to its ornamental value and adaptability to local climates. It thrives in mountainous areas with well-drained soils and moderate rainfall. The plant is often cultivated in gardens and parks for its vibrant fall foliage. Its introduction has also contributed to the biodiversity of these regions.
